name: ROBOTS WAR 3D
description:
Time ago I recovered some of my very, very old projects from an hard drive,  including those related to "ROBOTS WAR 3D" saga;  I've tried to run these latter on Windows 10 and, surprisingly, they work.

The "ROBOTS WAR 3D" saga consists in several minigames, so I enjoyed finishing them and now I have decided to share two of them



ROBOTS WAR 3D - v1 - One on One

In this version you are the Commander of the MechWarriors, a robots army. Computer leads the MetalKnights, your opponent robots army.

The aim of the game is to score more points than your opponent in the time period (you can choose to play a period time from 5 to 10 minutes) controlling of as many as possible of the 3 nodes.

Each army has 4 players/robots at a time.

When a your robot is destroyed, a new robot places to your disposal at the starting game corner position.

To move your robots, left-mouse clicking a destination on every point of the floor of battle arena.

Score:
4 points every 10 seconds for 1 node, 
9 points every 10 seconds for 2 nodes,
15 points every 10 seconds for 3 nodes.

To move your camera view on the battlefield, holding mouse on the borders of screen or press the following key:

"W" key to move the camera forward 
"S" key to move the camera backward 
"A" key to move the camera left
"D" key to move the camera right
"Q" key turn the camera counter-clockwise
"E" key turn the camera clockwise
"Z" key zoom +
"X" key zoom -

Check out the README file for full and more detailed informations


ROBOTS WAR 3D - v5 - All against All

 In this version you will be the commander of a mech warriors army 
while the computer will drive all other metal knights.

Each army fights against all the others, using one robot at a time.

The army is identified by a color: blue, red, yellow and grey; you will be able to choose the prefered color of your army at the beginning of the game.

The aim of the game is to destroy as many opposing robots as possible in a time period (you can choose from 2 to 10 minutes game time); 
with the same number of kills, the lower number of losses is evaluated  to determine the winner.

When a robot is destroyed, a new robot is made available to the army at the starting position angle of the battle arena, assigned at the start of the game.

In this version, the robots can rotate the upper part of the chassis by 360° and the camera is integral with the rotation of the upper chassis

Controls 

"W" key move the robot forward
"S" key  move the  robot backward
"A" key  turn left the robot
"D" key  turn right the robot

Move mouse to rotate the upper chassis of your robots
Click left button of mouse or press "Ctrl" key to shoot

Check out the README file for full and more detailed informations
